" My name is Zizhun Guo. I'm currently a master's student studying Computer Science at Rochester Institute of Technology."
" As I used to be a Game design & development student, I have been in the US nearly four years. After I earned a master's degree from GDD, I decided to further pursue the Computer Science field, since I want to develop the products which have the greater uses and influences to the human society. How exciting would that be, huh!?""
" People who know me best say that I am a chill and open-minded person. I like traveling to different places where I can talk to strangers so that to physically experience the local culture and conventions. I also like reading books especially essays to gain more experiences and thoughts which give me inspiration that could help me improve myself."
" Speaking to my working habits and problem-solving strategies, I like making summaries once in a while from the feedback that either in kind of success or failure to analyze the stage of progress. I like asking myself why I am doing this, how I am going to solve this, what the point of it is. I like to seek better solutions to improve efficiency and enhance my ability. I'm also a fast learner. "
" Quote I like: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better. "
[Updates]
2020.3 - Coronavirus Outbreak - Some thoughts: Some thoughts: Back in Jan, when the virus firstly became epidemic in China, I was physically in Rochester and bombarded by the virus news every single day. Until later when the epidemic gradually under control, I finally got a bit relieved not only because the people I know (my parents, relatives, and friends in Chengdu) were not much influenced by the virus, but also it was hard for the virus affects the US and the local people' lives. It was until after the spring break that RIT determined to shut down the campus and make the classes online that eventually brought me back to the previous feelings that I am now truly physically in the pandemic. Luckily, I am very healthy, and so do my friends, classmates, and professors. Though Rochester is in New York State, the local situation, for now, looks not bad and the local government reacts fast and people actively cooperate with the new policy. Listening to the federal briefing and Governer Cuomo's briefing, I stay home and keep watching over the updated news about the virus. For some moments, I think about the word 'Resilience', since it is the best word I can think which can help people get through a tough time. However, It is also a challenge and a trial for all of us to harden our beliefs. As I have been through the Wenchuan earthquake in 2008, where the disaster caused over thirty thousand mortality, experiencing the sad stories by my side during the days, I know what character traits people should own in the bad situation. I believe this pandemic would though take away many beautiful souls and people we love but, as the side effect that we don't want to have in this way, it strengthens the people's minds and makes us stronger so that our soul will never be defeated by the virus. No need to be panic. I am fully confident in the US to win the battle against the pandemic, and myself as well to move on life adapting to the new situation and continue to be working hard.
2020.1.13 - Course: Web Services & Services Oriented Computation. Professor: Xumin Liu. This course requires us use Web Services API to write mashup web app, customized and deployed our own SOAP API, combining MongoDB and do Data Mining. Course: Big Data Analytics. Professor: Thomas Kinsman. This is the advanced course for Data Mining. It includes topics as of all most often popular clustering, classification algorithms. It requires using Python to do projects.
Spring Semester - This is my last second semester. I have only two courses left, which will be taken this semester. I have only one capstone project left, which would be performed in the last semester. I'm expected to be graduated in Dec 2020, but I can alwasy extend it to May 2021 if I have opportunity to do one more 2020 Fall Co-op.

Winter break - I'm re-developing my personal website for making it more concise and condense, so it becomes more efficient to update & show my info.
